thread.title: ‘Origin Story’ Review: The View From Above

author: David Wootton
title: ‘Origin Story’ Review: The View From Above
text: Two millennia ago, Lucretius wrote a vast poem called “On the Nature of Things.” His goal was to explain the workings of the universe and the history of human beings. Above all, he wanted to rescue his readers from a superstitious fear of the gods and of the afterlife: We are mortal, he insisted, and our only purpose in life is to enjoy ourselves. We should delight in the extraordinary fecundity of nature, savor simple pleasures and look forward without fear to our inevitable end. “Happy is he who has discovered the causes of things and has cast beneath his feet all fears, unavoidable fate, and the din of the devouring...
